how: if i wanted to can i uninstall gnome?
is xfce not a desktop manager
i'd just install xfce over top of it; you don't need to remove gnome, and it'd be nice to have a fallback in case you don't like it (though i doubt that :)
then, restart gdm and you can change "sessions"
from where did you get the packages?
you should get the ones from os-works.com; they have the newer version.
and while you're there, set up the deb repository.
you should take this conversation to #xfce where someone could help you; this isn't an ubuntu problem.
